intro: Tanacetum subsimile, commonly known as the similar tansy, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its yellowish-green flower heads. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm and produces small, composite flowers that bloom in late summer. Its leaves are finely divided and aromatic, often used in traditional herbal medicine. Tanacetum subsimile is also valued in horticulture for its ornamental appeal and ability to thrive in well-drained soils.
